class_description:
NSKeyedUnarchiver, a concrete subclass of NSCoder, defines methods for decoding a set of named objects (and scalar values) from a keyed archive. Such archives are produced by instances of the NSKeyedArchiver class.
A keyed archive is encoded as a hierarchy of objects. Each object in the hierarchy serves as a namespace into which other objects are encoded. The objects available for decoding are restricted to those that were encoded within the immediate scope of a particular object. Objects encoded elsewhere in the hierarchy, whether higher than, lower than, or parallel to this particular object, are not accessible. In this way, the keys used by a particular object to encode its instance variables need to be unique only within the scope of that object.
If you invoke one of the decode... methods of this class using a key that does not exist in the archive, a non-positive value is returned. This value varies by decoded type. For example, if a key does not exist in an archive, decodeBool(forKey:) returns false, decodeInt(forKey:) returns 0, and decodeObject(forKey:) returns nil.
NSKeyedUnarchiver supports limited type coercion. A value encoded as any type of integer, whether a standard int or an explicit 32-bit or 64-bit integer, can be decoded using any of the integer decode methods. Likewise, a value encoded as a float or double can be decoded as either a float or a double value. If an encoded value is too large to fit within the coerced type, the decoding method throws a rangeException. Further, when trying to coerce a value to an incompatible type, for example decoding an int as a float, the decoding method throws an invalidUnarchiveOperationException.

params.param_description: An archive previously encoded by NSKeyedArchiver.

return_description: An NSKeyedUnarchiver object initialized for for decoding data.

Methods.method_description: Initializes the receiver for decoding an archive previously encoded by NSKeyedArchiver.

params.param_description: An object graph previously encoded by NSKeyedArchiver.

return_description: The object graph previously encoded by NSKeyedArchiver and stored in data.

Methods.method_description: Decodes and returns the object graph previously encoded by NSKeyedArchiver and stored in a given NSData object.
Methods.method_declar: class func unarchiveObject(with data: Data) -> Any?

params.param_description: A path to a file that contains an object graph previously encoded by NSKeyedArchiver.

return_description: The object graph previously encoded by NSKeyedArchiver written to the file path. Returns nil if there is no file at path.

Methods.method_description: Decodes and returns the object graph previously encoded by NSKeyedArchiver written to the file at a given path.
Methods.method_declar: class func unarchiveObject(withFile path: String) -> Any?

params.param_description: A key in the archive within the current decoding scope. key must not be nil.

return_description: true if the archive contains a value for key within the current decoding scope, otherwise false.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the archive contains a value for a given key within the current decoding scope.

params.param_description: The type of the value to decode.
The key in the archive associated with the value to decode.

Methods.method_description: Decodes a decodable value associated with a given key.
Methods.method_declar: @nonobjc func decodeDecodable<T>(_ type: T.Type, forKey key: String) -> T? where T : Decodable

params.param_description: The type of the value to decode.
The key in the archive associated with the value to decode.

Methods.method_description: Decodes a top-level decodable value associated with a given key.
Methods.method_declar: @nonobjc func decodeTopLevelDecodable<T>(_ type: T.Type, forKey key: String) throws -> T? where T : Decodable

params.param_description: A key in the archive within the current decoding scope. key must not be nil.

return_description: The Boolean value associated with the key key. Returns false if key does not exist.

Methods.method_description: Decodes a Boolean value associated with a given key.

params.param_description: A key in the archive within the current decoding scope. key must not be nil.
Upon return, contains the number of bytes returned.

return_description: The stream of bytes associated with the key key. Returns NULL if key does not exist.

Methods.method_description: Decodes a stream of bytes associated with a given key.
Methods.method_declar: func decodeBytes(forKey key: String, returnedLength lengthp: UnsafeMutablePointer<Int>?) -> UnsafePointer<UInt8>?

params.param_description: A key in the archive within the current decoding scope. key must not be nil.

return_description: The double-precision floating-point value associated with the key key. Returns 0.0 if key does not exist.

Methods.method_description: Decodes a double-precision floating-point value associated with a given key.

params.param_description: A key in the archive within the current decoding scope. key must not be nil.

return_description: The single-precision floating-point value associated with the key key. Returns 0.0 if key does not exist.

Methods.method_description: Decodes a single-precision floating-point value associated with a given key.

params.param_description: A key in the archive within the current decoding scope. key must not be nil.

return_description: The 32-bit integer value associated with the key key. Returns 0 if key does not exist.

Methods.method_description: Decodes a 32-bit integer value associated with a given key.

params.param_description: A key in the archive within the current decoding scope. key must not be nil.

return_description: The 64-bit integer value associated with the key key. Returns 0 if key does not exist.

Methods.method_description: Decodes a 64-bit integer value associated with a given key.

params.param_description: A key in the archive within the current decoding scope. key must not be nil.

return_description: The object associated with the key key. Returns nil if key does not exist, or if the value for key is nil.

Methods.method_description: Decodes and returns an object associated with a given key.
Tells the receiver that you are finished decoding objects.

params.param_description: The class with which to replace instances of the class named codedName.
The ostensible name of a class in an archive.

Methods.method_description: Adds a class translation mapping to NSKeyedUnarchiver whereby objects encoded with a given class name are decoded as instances of a given class instead.
Methods.method_declar: class func setClass(_ cls: AnyClass?, forClassName codedName: String)

params.param_description: The ostensible name of a class in an archive.

return_description: The class from which NSKeyedUnarchiver instantiates an object encoded with the class name codedName. Returns nil if NSKeyedUnarchiver does not have a translation mapping for codedName.

Methods.method_description: Returns the class from which NSKeyedUnarchiver instantiates an encoded object with a given class name.

params.param_description: The class with which to replace instances of the class named codedName.
The ostensible name of a class in an archive.

Methods.method_description: Adds a class translation mapping to the receiver whereby objects encoded with a given class name are decoded as instances of a given class instead.
Methods.method_declar: func setClass(_ cls: AnyClass?, forClassName codedName: String)

params.param_description: The name of a class.

return_description: The class from which the receiver instantiates an encoded object with the class name codedName. Returns nil if the receiver does not have a translation mapping for codedName.

Methods.method_description: Returns the class from which the receiver instantiates an encoded object with a given class name.

Methods.method_declar: @nonobjc class func unarchiveTopLevelObjectWithData(_ data: Data) throws -> Any?

@nonobjc static func unarchivedObject<DecodedObjectType>(ofClass cls: DecodedObjectType.Type, from data: Data) throws -> DecodedObjectType? where DecodedObjectType : NSObject, DecodedObjectType : NSCoding
@nonobjc static func unarchivedObject(ofClasses classes: [AnyClass], from data: Data) throws -> Any?

Vars.var_description: Indicates whether the receiver requires all unarchived classes to conform to NSSecureCoding.
The name of the exception raised by NSKeyedArchiver if there is a problem extracting an archive.
